doc.title: Access Market Data
doc.excerpt: Access real-time and historical market data, including sales, orders, and metadata
doc.body:
Reservoir offers developers easy access to real-time and historical market data for NFTs. Integrating with Reservoir provides your users a comprehensive view of the entire market and the ability to make informed decisions about buying and selling NFTs.

There are several ways to access NFT market data using Reservoir:

- [Reservoir API](doc:reservoir-api)- an all-in-one NFT data and liquidity API. Get access to all the data you need to contextualize the market
- [Reservoir's Dune Dataset](doc:dune-dataset)- Leverage Dune’s user-friendly dashboard interface to query Reservoir data.
- [Sync with Reservoir](doc:sync-with-reservoir)- use Reservoir’s data endpoints to sync your database directly with Reservoir

Our data includes:

- Activity data - Get a feed of activity (new listings, bids, transfers and sales) at the collection, token, or user level. This data can be used to build activity feeds. 
- Collection data - Search for collections, get collection information and metadata, get for users' collections, or create a custom collection set
- Attribute data - Collection attribute data including counts, floor prices and top bids
- Token data - Token metadata and market data including floor prices and top bids, flagged token status, and royalty compliance
- Market statistics - Daily collection volumes and users' total bid liquidity
- Price event data - Events for changes in token and collection floor prices and top bids
- Order data - bids and asks filtered by token, collection or maker
- Ownership data - a variety of ownership data endpoints including collection ownership, owner distribution, and cross collection ownership.
- Sales data - Recent and historical sales for a contract or token
- Marketplace source data - Marketplace sources for attributing orders to specific marketplaces
- Transfer data - Recent and historical NFT transfers
